On [[4 October]] [[1965]], [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] sent '''[[Letters not published in "The Letters of J.R.R. Tolkien"
thumb]]: a letter]] to Agatha Carew Hunt'''.<ref name=C>{{CG
column6: articlename=Something to celebrate: 30 years The Letters of J. R. R. Tolkien

*'''Subject:''' A stock reply (written by Tolkien's secretary on 11 May) to a letter of appreciation. However, Tolkien discovers the letter on 4 October, and adds a note of apology.

column3: Scull]] published a description of the letter in their [[The J.R.R. Tolkien Companion and Guide
column4: ''The J.R.R. Tolkien Companion and Guide: Chronology'']] (p. 644). A photograph of the letter was reproduced in ''[[Dominic Winter Children's and Illustrated Books, Modern First Editions 2003]]''.<ref>{{webcite

thumb]]: I am v sorry that this note was not posted until now 4/10/65. A change of secretary and a load of work suddenly imposed on me by [[Ace Books
column3:
USA "pirates"]] is responsible. I have just found this in a pile of neglect, clearing up before going away.

Best wishes

J.R.R. Tolkien}}
